review: Ours worked for about 3 months flawlessly. At first, we used it pretty regularly to stream Netfix and Hulu. Then we replaced our main TV with a smart TV and stopped using the Chromecast for several months. Recently, we decided to connect it to one of our other TVs. It would stream for 5-10 mins then stop and disconnect/drop the connection on its own. We've tried resetting it and setting it up over and over again, but to no avail. It's just maddening to try to use this thing. I've researched online for help and I just find endless forums of folks with the same issues with their Chromecast but no solutions so far. Needless to say, Google customer service is non existent! Spare yourself the frustration and don't waste your money on this!!

review: I got the Google Chromecast as a gift last Christmas. I'm pretty tech savvy, and after a few minutes to set up, I was ready to start casting from my pic, to my computer...or was I? It turns out that only the latest and greatest Google devices (not tied specifically to a certain OS, as I had 4.4) and all of my Samsung devices and tablets were not compatible with the Chromecast browser extension. When I used (of all things!) my iPad as my remote, it worked. I could cast from my tablets YouTube and Netflix, to Chromecast. On my PC however, I couldn't reliably stream anything. Connectivity is poor, and the constant results of having to reboot the Chromecast every fifteen minutes because it inexplicably loses its connection, rendered the device utterly useless. I literally threw it in the trash, and I've watch Arrow and The Flash, buffer and disconnect free ever since.Don't buy this device, and instead spend your money on either a bigger monitor, or Apple TV.
